query.description: Filter data equal to or after this time in RFC-3339 format. Fractions of a second are not accepted.
Filter data equal to or before this time in RFC-3339 format. Fractions of a second are not accepted.
Timeframe for the aggregation. Values are customizeable, frequently used examples: 1Min, 15Min, 1Hour, 1Day.
The data feed, defaults iex for free users and sip for users with a subscription.
Specifies the corporate action adjustment for the stocks. Enum: ‘raw’, ‘split’, ‘dividend’ or ‘all’. Default value is ‘raw’.
Number of data points to return. Must be in range 1-10000, defaults to 1000.
Pagination token to continue from.

The inclusive start of the interval. Format RFC-3339 or YYYY-MM-DD. If missing, the default value is the beginning of the current day. in Central Time.
The inclusive end of the interval. Format RFC-3339 or YYYY-MM-DD. If missing, the default value is the current time.
Number of maximum data points to return in a response. The limit applies to the total number of data points, not per symbol! You can use the next_page_token to fetch the next at most limit responses.
Pagination token to continue from. The value to pass here is returned in specific requests when more data is available than the request limit allows.
One of the following exchanges: ERSX, GNSS or CBSE

Comma separated list of symbols.

The timeframe of the bar aggregation. 5Min for example creates 5 minute aggregates. You can use the following values:
- [1-59]Min / T
- [1-23]Hour / H
- 1Day / D
- 1Week / W
- [1,2,3,4,6,12]Month / M
The inclusive start of the interval. Format RFC-3339 or YYYY-MM-DD. If missing, the default value is the beginning of the current day. in Central Time.
The inclusive end of the interval. Format RFC-3339 or YYYY-MM-DD. If missing, the default value is the current time.
Number of maximum data points to return in a response. The limit applies to the total number of data points, not per symbol! You can use the next_page_token to fetch the next at most limit responses
Pagination token to continue from. The value to pass here is returned in specific requests when more data is available than the request limit allows.
Comma separated list of symbols.
The comma-separated symbols to query for
The comma-separated exchanges we query for: ERSX, GNSS or CBSE, default: All

variable.description: The symbol of the cryptocurrency to query for.

query.description: Comma separated list of symbols.
The exchange from which to query the data from.
The comma-separated symbols to query for.
The comma-separated exchanges we query for: ERSX, GNSS or CBSE, default: ERSX,GNSS
Comma separated list of symbols.
(RFC 3339) Start date to start retrieving news articles
(RFC 3339) End date of period to retrieve news articles
List of symbols to retrive news
Limit of news items to be returned for given page
Sort articles by updated date. Options: DESC, ASC
Boolean indicator to include content for news aritcles (if available)
Boolean indicator to exclude news articles that do not contain content
Pagination token to continue on the next givne page
